intro: Onosma malkarmayorum, commonly known as the Malkarmay Mountains eveningflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, featuring deep root systems and hairy foliage to reduce water loss. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas with limited rainfall. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
